intro: Trithyrocarpus oligospatha, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandalwood, is a tropical tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its slender, straight trunk and aromatic, fragrant wood. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered a threatened species in some regions.
